The surveys were conducted June 2 and June 3, making this the first Texas poll since the murder of George Floyd.  "This poll shows in the starkest terms yet...
sourceClass: Government Agencies (U.S.), Government Policy, Local Government, National Government
text:
Austin, TX: Texas Democratic Party has issued the following news release:

Today, at the beginning of the Texas Democratic Party's general sessions at
the 2020 Texas Democratic Convention, a new PPP poll shows Joe Biden and
Donald Trump tied in the state of Texas, with 48% of the vote each.

The surveys were conducted June 2 and June 3, making this the first Texas poll
since the murder of George Floyd.

Other key takeaways include:

Trump's approval underwater at 46% approve, 50% disapprove in Texas.

Joe Biden with a resounding 97%-1% lead among African American voters.

2016 voter numbers at 50% Trump, 41% Clinton, nailing the spread of Texas in
the 2016 Presidential Election.

Texas Democratic Party Executive Director Manny Garcia issued the following
statement:

"Texans are demanding change. More and more voters are disqualifying Trump as
a voting option.

"This most recent Texas poll follows his administration's anti-democratic gas
attacks on peaceful protestors -- including clergy \-- in Lafayette Square,
all to score a cynical photo op with Trump holding a bible upside down.

"This poll shows in the starkest terms yet that Texas is neck-and-neck and
within grasp for Joe Biden and the Democratic ticket in November.

"Poll after poll shows that Texans increasingly trust Democrats to lead.
Across our state, voters understand that Texas Democrats are fighting to keep
our families safe, increase access to healthcare, provide responsible
leadership in this time of crisis, hold police accountable, and create an
economic plan that looks out for working Texans. Texans are looking for
leaders who will fight for their fair shot to get ahead. Our time is now."

title: New Poll Shows Joe Biden and Donald Trump Tied in Texas.
html:
Austin, TX: Texas Democratic Party has issued the following news release:

Today, at the beginning of the Texas Democratic Party's general sessions at the 2020 Texas Democratic Convention, a new PPP poll shows Joe Biden and Donald Trump tied in the state of Texas, with 48% of the vote each.

The surveys were conducted June 2 and June 3, making this the first Texas poll since the murder of George Floyd.

Other key takeaways include:

Trump's approval underwater at 46% approve, 50% disapprove in Texas.

Joe Biden with a resounding 97%-1% lead among African American voters.

2016 voter numbers at 50% Trump, 41% Clinton, nailing the spread of Texas in the 2016 Presidential Election.

Texas Democratic Party Executive Director Manny Garcia issued the following statement:

"Texans are demanding change. More and more voters are disqualifying Trump as a voting option.

"This most recent Texas poll follows his administration's anti-democratic gas attacks on peaceful protestors -- including clergy -- in Lafayette Square, all to score a cynical photo op with Trump holding a bible upside down.

"This poll shows in the starkest terms yet that Texas is neck-and-neck and within grasp for Joe Biden and the Democratic ticket in November.

"Poll after poll shows that Texans increasingly trust Democrats to lead. Across our state, voters understand that Texas Democrats are fighting to keep our families safe, increase access to healthcare, provide responsible leadership in this time of crisis, hold police accountable, and create an economic plan that looks out for working Texans. Texans are looking for leaders who will fight for their fair shot to get ahead. Our time is now."
